[h1]Dead Not By Daylight[/h1]

0/ Hey there. Here is just my humble opinion about Dead by Daylight I have after playing around 90 hours. My english is not the best but I just hope to tell more people about my experience.

[b]Pros first[/b]
Unique game play. Most ‚ÄúPreys VS Predator‚Äù games are very rare now, most of them are already dead or just don‚Äôt have enough players.
Fun? Yeah it‚Äôs pretty fun to play if you have more people to play with. First hours are especially fun while you learn basics and gameplay mechanics. Sometimes it‚Äôs even a funny moments generator. So if you don‚Äôt know what to play with friends, maybe this is a nice idea.

[b]Pros are over. Now to cons.[/b]
Progression system. It‚Äôs pretty fun, as I said already, to play first hours, learning things. Then you‚Äôll find yourself stuck with a limited amount of perks (passive skills that change your playstyle). The problem is about how you can acquire new perks. Every playable character in the game has its own unique pack of perks, leveling that character to higher levels will allow you to ‚Äúopen‚Äù its perks to be allowed to learn by all your other characters. Good thing that you don‚Äôt need to play on exact character to level up. So it takes just some time to get new perks? Yeah, BUT! You have only 6 free characters at start and can open only their perks correspondingly. To open other characters you can pay - check dlc packs, or just buy them through the game store. Yes you can open them for free using unique currency which is earned just by playing the game. But look at my 90 hours. Yes, I just earned enough to get only one new character. And you cannot boost that currency income somehow because it does not depend on your skill but by hours you play (there is only progress for each minute you play in a match, not by sitting in main menu). Fortunately you will have access to all perks if you play in a custom match (with your friends) regardless of which characters you have unlocked (but to play on specific killers you still need to have them unlocked).
All of the above might just be nitpicking but don‚Äôt forget that this game is not free to play.

Second problem is monkeys. This game was made by monkeys. I have no other words to describe how bad the game's netcode and some critical gameplay mechanics. Latency is one part of all problems - if a killer has high ping, you‚Äôll take hits while he is far far away and it happens so often that it will make hole in your pretty gaming chair. In rare situations, the killer will even teleport over the map. The game does not compensate ping problems in any way.
Additionally the game does not check anything on the server side which opens up endless opportunities for cheaters. Just check on YT that spectrum of cheat mechanics and be horrified that you cannot even determine who is a real cheater, cause most of things may be argued as ‚Äúlag‚Äù or ‚Äúbug‚Äù or whatever.
[hr][/hr]
I will not say anything about ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù. This is competitive, in some way, game, not a cozy life simulator, so anything could happen. You just should be ready to play with any random player.

In conclusion, the game is pretty fun to play with company or alone as a killer the first few ten hours. You should pay or play A LOT to get all new characters and their perks and you should be ready to face a really huge amount of game problems.

GLHF. Or not.
The game is really good I do feel as if there is a bit of a balance issue with the perks yet if we minus that a 10/10 game
